when: No wind turbine or no relevant turbine area (blade, hub/spinner, nacelle, tower) is visible.
The relevant area cannot be assessed (e.g., too blurry, too far away, occluded), so no statement about damage is possible.
A wind turbine/component area is clearly visible.
No damage of the defined classes is visible (VG;MT, LE;ER, LR;DA, LE;CR, SF;PO).
A wind turbine/component area is visible.
At least one damage class is visible.

class_triggers.VG;MT: Gaps/missing sections in the tooth row of the vortex generating panel; teeth are missing locally.
class_triggers.LE;ER: Abrasion/wash-out/discoloration along the leading edge, often elongated or stripe-like.
class_triggers.LE;CR: Linear crack/fracture line on or directly along the leading edge, clearly delineated.
class_triggers.LR;DA: Local damage at the lightning receptor, typically near the blade tip.
class_triggers.SF;PO: Locally missing/abraded coating, chipped coating, or scuff marks on the surface.

output_constraints: Descriptions are declarative (no follow-up questions or hints like 'please provide more information').

findings.image_description: The image shows a rotor blade. Two separate defect areas are visible on the vortex generating panel on the blade surface; one more on the left side of the visible blade area and the second further to the right in the mid-to-right area. In these locations, teeth are missing from the VG panel, consistent with VG;MT (Vortex Generating Panel - Missing Teeth).
The image shows the tip of a rotor blade. Local damage at the lightning receptor is visible directly in the tip area, consistent with LR;DA (Lightning Receptor - Damage).
The image shows a rotor-blade section. Several separate, line-shaped cracks are visible along the leading edge, consistent with LE;CR (Leading Edge - Crack).
The image shows a rotor-blade section in the outer blade area. Local abrasion and discoloration near the leading edge are visible, consistent with LE;ER (Leading Edge - Erosion).
The image shows a rotor-blade section. Locally abraded or missing coating is visible on the blade surface, consistent with SF;PO (Surface - Paint-Off).
The image shows a rotor blade. In the upper area near the leading edge, elongated abrasion and discoloration marks are visible, consistent with LE;ER (Leading Edge - Erosion).
The image shows a rotor blade. In the central area of the blade surface, a localized area with abraded or missing coating is visible, consistent with SF;PO (Surface - Paint-Off).
The image shows two rotor blades. On the front blade, several separate, line-shaped damages along the leading edge are visible, consistent with LE;CR (Leading Edge - Crack).
The image shows two rotor blades. On the vortex generating panel, two separate locations where teeth are missing are visible, consistent with VG;MT (Vortex Generating Panel - Missing Teeth).

examples.image_description: A rotor blade is clearly visible; no damage of the defined classes is detectable.
No wind turbine or relevant turbine area is visible; a damage assessment is not possible.
